name: Selector
classdesc:
JET Selector

Description: A checkbox to support selection in Collection Components

The oj-c-selector is a component that may be placed within a template for Table, ListView. It presents as a checkbox when the Collection Component is configured for multi-selection. 


<oj-c-list-view
   id="listview"
   data="[[dataProvider]]"
   selected="{{selectedItems}}"
   selection-mode="[[selectedSelectionMode]]">
 <template slot="itemTemplate" data-oj-as="item">
   <oj-c-list-item-layout>
     <oj-c-selector
       slot="selector">
     </oj-c-selector>
     <span>
       <oj-bind-text value="[[item.data.name]]"></oj-bind-text>
     </span>
   </oj-c-list-item-layout>
 </template>
</oj-c-list-view>

Accessibility

Application must specify a value for the aria-label attribute with a meaningful description of the purpose of this selector in order for this to be accessible.

tstype.value: interface CSelectorElement<K extends string | number> extends JetElement<SelectorElementSettableProperties<K>>

ojsignature.value: interface CSelectorElement<K extends string | number> extends JetElement<SelectorElementSettableProperties<K>>

name: rowKey
description:
Specifies the row key of each selector. Note that if the selector is used inside one of these components:
  • oj-c-card-view
  • oj-c-list-view
Then the selector will retrieve this directly from the above component and therefore this attribute should not be set.

name: selectedKeys
description:
Specifies the selectedKeys. Note that if the selector is used inside one of these components:
  • oj-c-card-view
  • oj-c-list-view
Then the selector will retrieve this directly from the above component and therefore this attribute should not be set.

name: indeterminate
description:
Specifies if the selector should show the visual partial state.
The original checked state of the selector will still be maintained.
User selection of checkboxes will remove the indeterminate state and reveal the checkbox state.
Otherwise, programmatically changing the checkbox state will not change the indeterminate state.

name: selectionMode
description:
Specifies the selection mode ('single', 'multiple'). For selection mode 'all', please refer to oj-c-selector-all component. Note that if the selector is used inside one of these components:
  • oj-c-card-view
  • oj-c-list-view
Then the selector will retrieve this directly from the above component and therefore this attribute should not be set.

ojvalues.name: multiple
ojvalues.description: Multiple items can be selected at the same time.

ojvalues.name: single
ojvalues.description: Only a single item can be selected at a time.

name: setProperty
description: Sets a property or a single subproperty for complex properties and notifies the component of the change, triggering a corresponding event.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to set. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

params.name: value
params.description: The new value to set the property to.

name: getProperty
description: Retrieves the value of a property or a subproperty.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to get. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

name: setProperties
description: Performs a batch set of properties.

params.name: properties
params.description: An object containing the property and value pairs to set.
